question: A process is a ________ program.
The OS is responsible for ________ and deleting processes.
Process management ensures that processes execute efficiently and do not ________ with each other.
The OS allocates ________ time to processes for execution.
Multitasking allows multiple ________ to run simultaneously.
Deadlocks occur when processes get stuck ________ for each other.
Main memory is also known as ________.
The OS uses ________ memory when RAM is full.
File management is responsible for storing, retrieving, and ________ files.
A file is a collection of ________ stored on a computer.
The OS manages files and stores them in ________.
I/O system management handles communication between the OS and ________ devices.
Device drivers help the OS communicate with ________.
Secondary storage includes hard drives, SSDs, and ________.
The OS is responsible for organizing data in ________ storage.
When a file is saved, the OS determines its ________ on the disk.
Without an OS, managing hardware and software would be extremely ________.
Process management ensures that programs do not ________ system resources.
The OS prevents ________ access to files through file permissions.
The OS assigns each running process a unique ________.
